business.headline: Auto stocks drive Sensex, Nifty gains on 2025's first trading dayStock market rally: The S&P BSE Sensex added 368.40 points to end at 78,507.41, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 98.10 points to close at 23,742.90.

Budget 2025: Should Nirmala Sitharaman focus on boosting consumption? India's GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in the second quarter of the current fiscal year, marking an 18-month low. This was primarily due to weak consumption.

Are BSE, NSE closed on January 1 for New year 2025?In India, the stock markets operate from Monday to Friday and remain closed on weekends, i.e., Saturdays and Sundays.

Looking to invest in stocks in 2025? 9 picks for your portfolio this New YearThe year 2024 has been decent for Indian stock markets. Both key market indices - the NSE Nifty 50 and the S&P BSE Sensex - went up by 9% during the year.

Income Tax extends Vivad Se Vishwas deadline to January 31. Key penalty detailsThe Income Tax Department has extended the Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme deadline to January 31, 2025, offering taxpayers a chance to settle disputes at reduced rates.

Dam Capital share price rebounds after Monday's slump. Here's whyDam Capital stock price:  By 11 am, the shares were trading 3.60% higher at Rs 385.70, recovering some ground lost during Monday's profit booking.

ITI share price hits record high as positive rally continuesITI share price: The recent rally has propelled ITI Ltd. above its 5-day, 20-day, 50-day, 100-day, and 200-day moving averages, underlining its robust performance across short- and long-term benchmarks.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 10 dead, 35 injured after vehicle rams crowd in US, driver opens fireA vehicle crashed into a crowd at the intersection of Bourbon Street and Iberville in New Orleans city and the driver exited the vehicle and started firing at people.

Can India retain Border Gavaskar Trophy at SCG? Here's what history saysBorder Gavaskar Trophy, IND vs AUS: India have won only 1 out of 13 Test matches at the Sydney Cricket Ground. India's New Year's Test against Pat Cummins' Australia starts on January 3.

Centre suggests places for Manmohan Singh's memorial, options sent to his familyThe central government has begun the process of building a memorial for former PM Dr Manmohan Singh, with his family asked to choose from proposed sites near Rajghat, Rashtriya Smriti Sthal, or Kisan Ghat.

Arvind Kejriwal writes to Mohan Bhagwat on BJP's 'wrongdoings', party hits backArvind Kejriwal wrote to the RSS chief questioning the BJP's actions, while the BJP responded by advising Kejriwal to stop lying and make truthful promises in New Year.

Gunshots, panic, bodies lying around: Moments after deadly New Orleans attackAt least 10 people were killed and over 30 injured after a vehicle ploughed into a crowd of people in central New Orleans on Wednesday morning.

Indian dressing room leaks from Australia leave ex-cricketers shockedFormer cricketers, including Irfan Pathan, have condemned the leaks from the Indian dressing room during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, following a news report about Gautam Gambhir's stern address to the team after their Boxing Day Test defeat. The controversy has added to the mounting pressure on the Indian team, which trails 1-2 in the series.

The Gen Beta era is here. What will define their journey?Children of younger millennials and older Gen Z, Gen Beta will be born into a world dominated by technology and AI.

Delhi bakery owner dies by suicide amid dispute over divorce, business with wifePuneet Khurana co-owned the bakery with his wife. The couple, who married in 2016, were in the middle of getting a divorce and a dispute arose in connection with their business.

Russian gas supply to Europe stops after Ukraine refuses to renew transit dealEurope turns a page on Russian gas. Decades of dependency end as Ukraine halts transit. Moscow's dominance fades, but the shift leaves financial losses on both sides. The EU moves forward with alternative supplies.

ICC Test Rankings: Jasprit Bumrah records highest-ever rating points by an Indian bowlerICC Test Rankings: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah created history on Wednesday, 1 January. Bumrah recorded the highest-ever rating points by an Indian bowler in Test cricket, surpassing Ravichandran Ashwin.

Man kills mother, 4 sisters after serving them alcohol, records confession videoArshad was arrested after he allegedly murdered his mother along with his four sisters over a family dispute on New Year's Eve.

BJP lists Arvind Kejriwal's 'ten failed promises', questions AAP's 'credibility'The BJP accused Arvind Kejriwal of failing to fulfil key promises, including lowering power tariffs, providing clean water, improving healthcare and education, and cleaning the Yamuna, even after a decade in power.

Meet India's best-selling electric car for 3rd straight monthThis electric car has recorded total sales of over 10,000 units in three months, beating all the models from Tata, Mahindra, Hyundai, Citroen and BYD.

How dynasties, sultanates and empires kept Delhi a power centre for centuriesFor centuries, even before the British arrived in India, Delhi was the centre of power in the region. From the Tomars, who were the first rulers of Delhi, and the Chauhans to the Sultans and the Mughals, all recognised the significance of what is now India's capital. Here's a glimpse into Delhi's 1,000-year journey of evolution.

Carlsen and Nepomniachtchi were declared joint winners of the tournament in New York on Tuesday, December 31.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
